body.p: Mucus lacking would not be able to perform the function of humidifying as well.

response.name: immunoglobulins
response.feedback: Incorrect. If the mucus were lacking immunoglobulins it would not be able to function as well in protecting our body from pathogens.

response.name: glycosylations
response.feedback: Correct. The glycosylations attached to proteins in the mucus allow for the mucus to attract large amounts of water which helps it hydrate the surrounding cells.

part.hint: Immunoglobulin is another word for an antibody
